result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rigoberto Valladares Montes De Oca

records.addlTxt: Cash bond applied; partial refund;  sg /mg   ck#22CH090459

10:30 AM
Defendant, Rigoberto Valladares Montes De Oca, appeared with Attorney David Saldana.
Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.
Spanish interpreter, Leo Martin, appeared in court.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Case was dismissed and read-in w/21CM1235.
$1,000 cash bond on deposit to be applied to restitution of $489.25 and forfeiture in 21CM1235, remainder to poster.

ADDRESS INFO for Rigoberto Valladares Montes De Oca
Current: 4113 23rd Avenue, ***L/K/A MAIL RETURNED 5/9/22****, Kenosha, WI 53140   (Effective: 03-16-2022)
Prior: 4113 23rd Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53140
DE's copy of Notice for hearing on 7/1/22 returned by the USPS; Moved, Left no Address
The 6/8/2022 Hearing has been rescheduled to 7/1/2022 at 10:30 am at the request of the defense attorney.  Interpreter requested.

01:34 PM 
Defendant, Rigoberto Valladares Montes De Oca, appeared with Attorney David Saldana.
Spanish Interpreter, Reme Bashi, appeared in court.
Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
21CM1235 & 22CM337:
Victim rights compliance.
Atty is not retained on 22CM337 case, requesting an adjournment, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Interpreter requested for next hrg.
Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: B.S.

02:27 PM    State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Spanish interpreter, Leo Martin, appeared in court.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  DE will retain his own counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm with other case 21CM1235.  $1000  Continued Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Cash bond on deposit $1000.  Last paragraph probable cause amended to 12-1-21 date.  ts
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
